articles.title: Kim Jong Un Looks Round Construction Site of Rest Home for Scientists
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Looks Round Construction Site of Rest Home for Scientists 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, went round the construction site of the rest home for scientists. 
					 In January this year Kim Jong Un visited Lake Yonphung right after giving field guidance to the State Academy of Sciences. He finally confirmed the site for the rest home which was chosen by him last year. He not only took detailed measures for designing it and ensuring the supply of construction materials but instructed KPA Unit 267 to undertake the construction. 
					
					 Inspecting the construction site, he was very pleased with the atmosphere in the work site of the unit, adding that it was worthy of the guard unit and hero unit. 
					
					 Going round different places of the construction site, he set forth the tasks to be fulfilled for building the rest home to be impeccable. 
					
					 He stressed the need to build all the buildings and facilities of the rest home in the best quality as befitting the highly civilized socialist country and to be proud of in the world. 
					
					 "It is necessary to build the gatepost of the rest home in a peculiar style and successfully construct a railway station close to it to the convenience of the holidaymakers," he noted, adding:
					
					 "The open-air playground for volleyball, tennis and badminton now under construction should have multi-purpose sporting facilities so that holidaymakers may enjoy skating in winter days." 
					
					 He called for building well an indoor swimming pool, a video room and an angling site and constructing modern welfare and service facilities including a public bath at the rest home.
					
					 He said: "The upper part of the boundary between land and water in the compound of the rest home should be covered with sand and its lower part with shingle. The parking lot and the promenade should be covered with blue stone."
					
					 He underscored the need to simultaneously push forward the construction and the work for installing a geothermal cooling and heating system and the production of furniture and fittings and make good arrangements for the operation of the rest home.
					
					 Noting the soldier-builders of Unit 267 of the KPA are creating a new speed by bringing about a leap forward in construction while building the rest home for scientists, he expressed conviction that by this speed they would certainly complete the project by the date the party promised scientists to wind up.
					
					 He urged all the officials in the field of construction to learn from the work style of Unit 267 of the KPA.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Pyon In Son and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Report on Results of DPRK-Japan Inter-Governmental Talks
articles.content:
Report on Results of DPRK-Japan Inter-Governmental Talks
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK-Japan inter-governmental talks were held in Stockholm, Sweden from May 26 to 28.
					 Present there were the DPRK delegation led by Ambassador of the Foreign Ministry Song Il Ho and the Japanese delegation led by Director of Asia and Oceania of the Foreign Ministry Junichi Ihara.
					
					 Both sides had an in-depth discussion on the issues of settling the inglorious past, settling pending issues and normalizing the bilateral relations according to the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 The Japanese side requested the DPRK side to conduct a survey of all Japanese, including the issue of the remains of the Japanese who died in the territory of the DPRK before and after the year 1945 and the remaining Japanese, Japanese spouses, victims of abduction and missing Japanese.
					
					 The DPRK side appreciated the Japanese side's recognition of the efforts made by the DPRK to settle the abduction issue in the past and expressed the willingness to conduct a comprehensive and full-scale survey for the final settlement of all issues related to Japanese though there is its previous stand.
					
					 The Japanese side voiced its intent to finally lift the sanctions against the DPRK which it has slapped independently at present.
					
					 Both sides agreed as follows, having a close discussion at an early date:
					
					 The Japanese side re-clarified its will to settle its inglorious past, solve the pending issues and normalize the relations together with the DPRK side according to the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration and take a sincere approach towards building confidence between the two countries and settling issues of improving the bilateral relations.
					
					 The Japanese side agreed to lift restrictions on visits of persons, lift special measure of restrictions taken against the DPRK regarding money remittance and money carried by visitors and lift the embargo on the entry of the DPRK-flagged ships with a humanitarian mission into the Japanese ports from the point of time that the DPRK side sets up a "special investigation committee" for the comprehensive survey and starts it.
					
					 The Japanese side agreed to examine the humanitarian aid to the DPRK at an appropriate time.
					
					 It also agreed to have a sincere discussion on the issue of the status of the Koreans in Japan according to the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 The Japanese side appreciated the cooperation rendered by the DPRK side in realizing the visits to ancestral graves in the DPRK by bereaved families of Japan as regards the issue of the remains of Japanese and agreed to take necessary measures, furthering the consultation with the DPRK side in connection with the handling of the remains of Japanese and their graves left uncared in the territory of the DPRK and the visits to the ancestral graves.
					
					 The Japanese side agreed to continue the survey of the Koreans who went missing in the past as requested by the DPRK side and take relevant steps through discussion with the DPRK side.
					
					 The DPRK side agreed to simultaneously conduct a comprehensive survey of all Japanese including the remains and graves of Japanese, remaining Japanese, Japanese spouses, victims of abduction and missing persons.
					
					 To this end, it agreed to set up the "special investigation committee" invested with special mandate and inform the Japanese side of the survey and confirmation when necessary. When survivors are found, while handling the remains of Japanese, the DPRK side agreed to discuss the issue of course of action and take necessary measures in the direction of sending them back to Japan.
					
					 It was agreed to make a prompt survey and deal with issues arising in this course in various forms and methods through continued discussion with the Japanese side.
					
					 In order to confirm issues arising in the comprehensive survey, both sides agreed to arrange meetings between those who wish to contact, realize their visits to the relevant places and take appropriate steps while sharing relevant information.

articles.title: New Vice-Premier Appointed
articles.content:
New Vice-Premier Appointed 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Im Chol Ung was appointed as vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet.
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK promulgated the relevant decree on May 22.

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Slams S. Korean Puppet Military's Anti-DPRK Provocative Hysteria
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Slams S. Korean Puppet Military's Anti-DPRK Provocative Hysteria
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Thursday released a statement denouncing the south Korean puppet military for desperately kicking up the racket of confrontation with the DPRK and provocations against it these days in a bid to tide over the crisis caused by the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 Due to the anti-DPRK plots and the military provocations of the south Korean puppet military hooligans, the north-south relations have reached an alarming phase and there is the serious danger of armed conflict in the area of the five islands in the West Sea of Korea, a hot spot, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 Park Geun Hye is zealously conniving at, patronizing and encouraging the conspiratorial racket and provocations of the military gangsters, asserting for no reason that "she trusts the army's judgment."
					
					 As regards the recent "fiction about firing by the north", Park held even an urgent meeting of ministers in charge of security, at which she vociferated about "provocation" and cried out for "tightening the posture for security." 
					
					 The most risky forces in south Korea at present are those of the puppet military.
					
					 As ministers in charge of security were fired one by one after being held accountable for the ferry Sewol disaster, the puppet military group is taking advantage of this happening and going reckless in its bid to demonstrate its clout, increase its say and please Park.
					
					 Now that the Park Geun Hye regime is in the grip of the worst ruling crisis due to the ferry Sewol disaster, the military group is kicking off provocative hysteria in an effort to turn the situation favorable to it through a military "shocking therapy".
					
					 Kim Kwan Jin is the mastermind behind these ridiculous acts.
					
					 If Kim Kwan Jin and other pro-U.S. military gangsters are allowed to go scot-free, they will only bring tragic misfortunes and disasters to south Korea.
					
					The DPRK will never overlook the reckless acts of Kim Kwan Jin and other military gangsters but sternly punish them.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korean Regime's Desperate Racket for Cooking up "North Wind"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korean Regime's Desperate Racket for Cooking up "North Wind"
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is desperately working to cook up the "north wind" with the elections to the local self-governing bodies at hand.
					 It dares accuse the DPRK, claiming the latter abuses the ferry Sewol disaster for "politically-motivated purposes" and attempts to "interfere in the elections" and the like.
					
					 While floating the fiction that the north would pose a threat by conducting a nuclear test, it is egging die-hard bellicose elements of the diplomatic and military circles onto letting loose such invectives that "the unification should be achieved with south Korea as a main player" and "the north is a country which should disappear".
					
					 Not content with kicking up the racket of "drones from the north", it is now hell-bent on confrontation with compatriots in the north and war moves against them after opening to public the "five-phase military strategy toward the north for unification."
					
					 This is a clear revelation of its sinister design to tide over its ruling crisis caused by the ferry Sewol disaster and to turn the situation before the elections in its favor.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime of south Korea is panic-stricken, pressurized by the public resentment and the anti-"government" actions of people of various circles mounting high in the wake of the ferry Sewol tragedy. 
					
					 This cannot but be a telling blow to the regime keen to consolidate its base for unpopular rule through the elections to the local self-governing bodies.
					
					 Hence, the puppet group is again resorting to the racket for fabricating the "north wind", a trite-method employed by it whenever the situation turns unfavorable to it.
					
					  Clumsy, indeed, is this racket intended to divert the public mindset to confrontation with compatriots in the north and crackdown upon progressive forces and thus justify its fascist rule.
					
					 No matter how desperately the Park group may work, the ruckus of "north wind" can never work as its conspiratorial nature has already been brought to light.
					
					 The south Korean people has branded the farce of "drones from the north" kicked up by the regime as part of the "north wind" campaign, as a poor charade and a reckless act of describing the door of a toilet as a drone.
					
					 When the group floated a story about the "north's shelling" after firing at warships of the Korean People's Army, it was pressurized by the people to produce evidence. However, it let loose such sheer sophism that it was impossible to confirm the firing as the radar for detecting the "base of firing" failed to operate at that time only to become a laughing stock of the public.
					
					 Recently, even lawmakers from the "Saenuri Party" admitted that the racket of opening to public the minutes of the north-south summit kicked up by the Park group with the approach of the December, 2012 "presidential" election was a farce staged in collusion with the puppet Intelligence Service to grab power.
					
					 As proved by history and reality, the "north wind" ruckus is a hideous crime perpetrated by the Park group to mock at and stamp out the public mindset and thus maintain its unpopular rule.
					
					 That is why south Korean people from all walks of life are now escalating their actions against the regime, holding "the authorities are seeking a way out of its crisis caused by the ferry Sewol disaster through the fabrication of north wind".
					
					 The Park group is bound to meet ruin, hit hard by the public angered by its criminal moves.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan for Rushing Headlong into Militarization and Lurch to Right
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan for Rushing Headlong into Militarization and Lurch to Right
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Japanese should feel shame for the history of crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past. It has become more shameful for Japanese politicians.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a commentary.
					
					 It is the irresistible requirement of the international community and moral duty of the Japanese government to deeply repent of its past crimes and make an apology and reparation for them with the correct outlook on history, it notes, and goes on:
					
					 However, Japan is rushing headlong into militarization and lurch to the Right, putting aside this historical task and giving rein to militarism.
					
					 Mayor of Osaka Hashimoto who co-heads the Japan Restoration Party told journalists that he was glad that the people have known about the comfort women system and it was natural to raise different opinion when one hears something different from the fact as regards the historical issue. 
					
					 These are reckless remarks insulting mankind once again and denying the past crimes again as it is a repetition of his remarks a year ago that the comfort women system for the Imperial Japanese Army was needed.
					
					 The international community is censuring and cursing Hashimoto, labeling his remarks denying the past crimes the ones of a shameless depraved guy and an ultra-right gangster steeped in militarism to the marrow of his bones.
					
					 It is the reality of Japan that this guy bereft of the qualification of not only politician but human being takes an important post in the government.
					
					 As the present chief executive of Japan is letting loose a string of reckless remarks denying the past history and calling for revising the constitution and turning Japan into a military power, Japan is rushing headlong into militarization and lurch to the Right.
					
					 One's evil doings will rebound on oneself. If one negates history, one is bound to be punished by Heaven.
					
					 Japan had better understand this truth at an early date.

articles.title: Greetings to Minister of International Relations and Cooperation of South Africa
articles.content:
Greetings to Minister of International Relations and Cooperation of South Africa
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Maite Nkoana-Mashabane upon his reappointment as minister of International Relations and Cooperation of South Africa.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations with a long history and tradition between the two countries would grow stronger by their joint efforts, wishing him fresh greater success in his work to develop the foreign relations of the country.

articles.title: Famous Actor Han Jin Sop Remembered on His 100th Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Famous Actor Han Jin Sop Remembered on His 100th Birth Anniversary 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A meeting to remember People's Artiste Han Jin Sop took place at the National Theatre on Thursday on the occasion of his 100th birth anniversary.
					 It was attended by officials, creators and artistes in the field of drama art, journalists and editors and his bereaved families and those related to him.
					
					 Ri Ji Yong, chairman of the C.C., the Theatrical Workers Union of Korea, spoke at the meeting.
					
					 He referred to the fact that supreme leader Kim Jong Un showed such loving care as making sure that such a meeting was held to remember the 100th birth anniversary of Han.
					
					 He recalled that President Kim Il Sung trained Han, who had to play a drama, traveling different places before the liberation of Korea, to be a prestigious one and led him with profound care to enjoy a worthwhile life for the development of the Juche-based literature and arts.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il praised Han, saying that his narrative skill was peculiar and his acting good while guiding feature film "Five Guerrilla Brothers" and revolutionary dramas "The Mountain Shrine" and "Blood at an International Conference" in which he acted.
					
					 Kim Jong Il projected Han as a veteran stage actor and showed such loving care for him as seeing to it that his remains were buried in the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery.
					
					 The speaker said that thanks to the benevolent love of the peerless great men, Han is immortal.
					
					 The floor was taken by Han's former fellow artistes.

articles.title: DPRK Marks World No-Tobacco Day
articles.content:
DPRK Marks World No-Tobacco Day 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- An event was held at the Grand People's Study House on Thursday to mark the World No-Tobacco Day.
					 Present there were officials in the field of public health, those of ministries, national institutions and public organizations and officials concerned.
					
					 Also on hand were staff members of missions of international bodies including the World Health Organization and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the event.
					
					 Speakers said that the WHO set the tobacco tax issue as this year's theme in order to increase the social cognition related to tobacco harmfulness and strengthen no-smoking activities.
					
					 Increasing tobacco tax and price will be an important lever for reducing the use of tobacco and protecting health and circumstance from smoking, they noted.
					
					 Then the participants toured the Ryugyong Dental Hospital.

articles.title: SPA Delegation Leaves for Syria
articles.content:
SPA Delegation Leaves for Syria
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) led by Deputy Kim Wan Su, presidium member of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea and director of its Secretariat, left here Thursday to visit Syria.

articles.title: Delegation of Journalists Union of Korea Returns Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Journalists Union of Korea Returns Home
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Journalists Union of Korea led by Jon Il Gwang, vice-chairman of the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea, returned home on Thursday after visiting China.

articles.title: Chief of Asia-Pacific Regional Office of Int'l Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies Visits Tower of Juche Idea
articles.content:
Chief of Asia-Pacific Regional Office of Int'l Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies Visits Tower of Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Chapagain Jagannath, chief of the Asia-Pacific Regional Office of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and his party  visited the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					 Being briefed on the grand monument conveying the great ideological and theoretical feats of the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, they looked round the tower and groups of sculptures and enjoyed a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang at the observation platform.
					
					 They also visited the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, etc.

articles.title: Brisk Silkworm-Raising in DPRK
articles.content:
Brisk Silkworm-Raising in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Silkworm-raising is progressing apace among women's union organizations and members across the DPRK.
					 The South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea is pushing ahead with silkworm-raising on the basis of the experience in which all cities and counties in the province overfulfilled their plans for cocoon production over the past ten years.
					
					 The North and South Phyongan, Kangwon and North Hwanghae provincial committees of the women's union focused their forces on creating mulberry fields.
					
					 The Ryongsong District Committee of Pyongyang City of the women's union created 25 hectares of mulberry fields and is registering great achievements in the production of mulberry leaves.
					
					 The Unchon County Committee of the women's union is thoroughly ensuring numbers of mulberry trees per hectare and manuring and tending them well. 
					
					 The Songhwa County Committee of the women's union is paying its primary efforts to raising the fertility of soil.
					
					 Members of the women's union in Sonchon County are creating a young mulberry plants field by their own efforts and introducing the advanced method of raising seedlings and thus producing tens of thousands of new variety of mulberry seedlings every year.
					
					 Organizations of the women's union in Anju, Kusong and Munchon cities, Hwangju and Jongphyong counties and Kangso District are effecting a great surge in cocoon production.
					
					 Women's union organizations across the country are pushing forward the work to conduct silkworm-raising to meet the scientific and technological requirement.

articles.title: FIH Coaching Course Given in DPRK
articles.content:
FIH Coaching Course Given in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A FIH (International Hockey Federation) coaching course took place here some days ago.
					 The 7-day course, held divided into theoretical and practical sections, dealt with the trend of the development in field hockey techniques and new rules under application at international games, etc.
					
					 It also dealt with such practical issues as means and methods of education and training for the enhancement of top players' ability, passing and dribbling techniques, efficient teamwork and promotion of the two and three men-pass ability.
					
					 The course served as an occasion to improve the qualification of coaches.

articles.title: New Penetration Rock-Drill Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Penetration Rock-Drill Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A new penetration rock-drill was developed by the Central Mining Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK, which has proved highly efficient in colliers, mines, tunnel construction sites.
					 In particular, it is regarded as powerful drilling equipment in the construction sites of power stations in tiers on the Chongchon River.
					
					 In this regard, Kim Su Chan, a section chief of the institute, told KCNA:
					
					 The penetrating rock-drill consists of 110-mm head, borer, rotary device and others.
					
					 Its penetration speed is 150mm per minute.
					
					 Its head is strong enough to drill up to 1,000m.
					
					 Its efficiency of work is equivalent to that of eight or ten rock drills.

articles.title: Dressing Plant in Usi Mine Goes Operational
articles.content:
Dressing Plant in Usi Mine Goes Operational
 Usi, May 29 (KCNA) -- A dressing plant went operational in the Usi Mine of Jagang Province.
					 The appearance of the modern dressing plant laid a foundation for keeping the ore production at a high rate and thus making a contribution to the economic development and the improvement of the standard of the people's living.
					
					 An inaugural ceremony of the plant was held on Thursday.
					
					 Chief Secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Kim Chun Sop made an inaugural speech.
					
					 He called upon the technicians and workers of the dressing plant to successfully conduct management of equipment and technical control and thus keep the plant in full-capacity operation and enhance the rate of actual extraction from concentrates as much as possible.
					
					 He also called upon the officials to pay primary attention to the supply service, push forward the work for establishing cultured practices in production and life and turn the compound of the mine and village into a fairyland of socialism.

articles.title: Korean Youth in Japan Call for Applying Tuition-free Program to Korean Schools
articles.content:
Korean Youth in Japan Call for Applying Tuition-free Program to Korean Schools
 Tokyo May 28 (KNS-KCNA) -- Representatives of the youth and students' association for supporting students of Korean schools on May 23 handed to the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan a written request and signature paper calling for an immediate application of the tuition-free program for senior high schools to Korean schools in Japan.
					 They said that Korean students were forced to choose Japanese schools as only Korean schools are excluded from the program and the right to learning on an equal footing is encroached upon.
					
					 They urged the ministry to settle the issue of applying the program in a responsible way.
					
					 The number of Japanese who sign their names in support of the settlement of the above-said issue is on increase, they said, adding the Japanese government is rendering an ear to the voices of opposition forces, not the voices of the people.
					
					 In the written request they said that it was a discriminatory act that the Japanese government and the ministry excluded Korean schools from the program by revising the ministry's decree on applying the program.
					
					 They noted that Korean schools have substantial conditions for the appliance of the program.
					
					 The actions for settling the issue are being launched in different parts of Japan, they said, demanding the Japanese government immediately apply the program to Korean schools.
					
					 On the same day students of Korea University and Tokyo Korea middle and high school and members of the mothers' society of the school waged a Friday action denouncing the Japanese authorities for discriminating Korean schools.

articles.title: Fire Breaks Out in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fire Breaks Out in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Fire broke out at a hospital in Jangsong, South Jolla Province on May 28, according to south Korean MBC. The fire left at least 20 persons dead and six persons in a critical condition.
					 Accidents in the wake of the ferry Sewol disaster are bringing only misfortune and pain to the south Korean people.

articles.title: Parents of S. Korean Students Protest against Puppet Regime
articles.content:
Parents of S. Korean Students Protest against Puppet Regime
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Parents of south Korean students protested against the unjust disciplinary measure to be taken by the puppet group against the participants in a declaration on the situation, according to a south Korean internet newspaper.
					 Some days ago the puppet Ministry of Education threatened that it would discipline the teachers who posted articles holding Park Geun Hye responsible for the ferry Sewol sinking disaster and demanding Park step down on the website of Chongwadae.
					
					 Meanwhile, it investigated over 15 000 teachers who participated in the declaration on the situation as regards the ferry disaster, talking about "violation of law".
					
					 In this regard parents of south Korean students posted an article titled "Who punishes whom?" on the website of Chongwadae on May 26.
					
					 They said that they saw the twisted education through the Sewol accident.
					
					 "Stay calm" was broadcast though the ferry was sinking, a clear proof showing the present situation of the twisted education, they noted, adding children and teachers were damaged most heavily.
					
					 The "government" is disqualified to discipline the teachers who participated in the declaration on the situation, they held.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime which cooked up the ferry tragedy with illegality, incompetence and greed should be disciplined by the people, they said.

articles.title: Italian Political Party Protests against Japan's Suppression of Chongryon
articles.content:
Italian Political Party Protests against Japan's Suppression of Chongryon 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Unified Communist Party of Italy on May 16 sent letters to the prime minister, Cabinet Secretariat, Foreign Ministry and Ministry of Justice of Japan in protest against the Japanese authorities' suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). 
					 The letter said:
					
					 It is a well-known fact that many Koreans who were taken away to Japan and forced to do slavery labor during the Second World War are still living there. 
					
					 The Korean Hall of Chongryon is the base for Koreans who were taken away to Japan and their descendants to get together and learn and preserve the national culture, tradition and history of their homeland. 
					
					 Chongryon is linking Koreans in Japan with the DPRK, their homeland. But the Japanese authorities are encroaching upon its dignity.
					
					 They should recognize Chongryon and stop suppressing it. 
					
					 We pay attention to the fact that all these are being committed by the Japanese right-wing forces that refuse to make an apology before the people who were subject to oppression by Japanese imperialism, patronize the war criminals and incite revanchism and ultra-nationalism. 
					
					 We hold that all Japan's moves including re-arming are related to the strategic goal of the U.S. to maintain world domination by monopolistic capital and military presence in Northeast Asia. 
					
					 We bitterly denounce the Japanese authorities for their frantic suppression of Chongryon.

articles.title: Brazilian Paper Reports about Anti-"Government" Struggle in S. Korea
articles.content:
Brazilian Paper Reports about Anti-"Government" Struggle in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian paper Hora do Povo on May 23 reported about the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster and the south Korean people's anti-"government" struggle under the bannerline "Resignation of Park Geun Hye demanded in south Korea".
					 Disclosing the truth behind the Sewol disaster, the paper said this was neither an accidental case nor unexpected disaster but a heinous massacre by the Park Geun Hye regime. 
					
					 The south Korean people's anger, grudge and curse at the Park Geun Hye group are running high as regards the Sewol disaster, the paper said.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Indonesian Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Indonesian Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- The Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange and the Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia released a joint statement on May 14 in response to the call of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea to mark the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Expressing full support for the call of the regional committee to hold an international internet seminar on his great career and undying exploits on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of his demise, the statement went on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung put the dignity of the popular masses on the highest ground and devoted his all to the welfare and development of mankind. 
					
					 He made immortal contributions to building a world free from all domination and subjugation and a new independent world where all countries and nations become masters of their destinies.
					
					 He energetically worked to implement the cause of global independence. He visited Indonesia together with HE Kim Jong Il in 1965 and opened up a new chapter for friendship and solidarity among developing countries. 
					
					 Kimilsungia blooming in the world came into being in Indonesia, a symbol of boundless reverence for him.
					
					 We will soon form the committee for remembering him. 
					
					 We will also take an active part in the international internet seminar and highly praise his great career and undying exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion de casa de reposo para cientificos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion de casa de reposo para cientificos
 Pyongyang, 29 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el campo de construccion de la casa de reposo para los cientificos.
					 En enero de este ano, en cuanto terminara su visita de orientacion sobre la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, el se traslado al lago Yonphung donde fijo definitivamente el solar de la casa de reposo que habia escogido personalmente el ano pasado.
					
					 En esa ocasion, tomo ademas las medidas concretas para el diseno y el suministro de materiales de construccion y movilizo la unidad 267 del EPC en la obra.
					
					 Al dar un vistazo sobre el campo de construccion, se puso muy satisfecho diciendo que le gusta mucho el ambiente del lugar donde trabaja la unidad 267 y esta es de veras la unidad vanguardia y heroica.
					
					 Mientras recorria varios puntos del campo de construccion, presento las siguientes tareas para edificar perfectamente la casa de reposo:
					
					 Hay que construir en el maximo nivel cualitativo todos los edificios y facilidades de la casa para que convengan a la figura de pais civilizado socialista y sean dignas de jactar al mundo.
					
					 Hace falta levantar de manera original la jamba de la casa y construir bien una estacion ferroviaria cerca de la casa para asegurar el trafico confortable de los inquilinos de ella.
					
					 Se debe acondicionar la cancha deportiva al aire libre, que se construye ahora para los juegos de voleibol, tenis y badminton, como establecimiento polivalente donde se pueda patinar en el invierno.
					
					 La casa debe tener una buena piscina bajo techo, la sala de videos, el sitio de pesca y la red de servicios publicos como bano publico.
					
					 Hay que colocar la arena blanca en la parte superior de la linea de limite entre la tierra y el agua en el recinto de la casa, la grava en la parte inferior de la misma linea y la piedra azul en el paseo.
					
					 Es necesario establecer al mismo tiempo el sistema de refrigeracion y calefaccion con recursos geotermicos e impulsar la produccion de muebles y los preparativos para la operacion de la casa de reposo.
					
					 El Mariscal sEl esenalo que los constructores militares de la unidad 267 estan creando en esta obra la nueva velocidad de auge.
					
					 Apunto convencido que con tal velocidad se podra terminar la construccion en la fecha prometida por el partido a los cientificos. 
					
					 Instruyo que todos los funcionarios y trabajadores de la rama de construccion deben aprender el temperamento de lucha y trabajo de la unidad 267 del EPC.
					
					 Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Hwang Pyong So, Pyon In Son y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Informacion sobre resultado de  conversaciones intergubernamentales RPDC-Japon
articles.content:
Informacion sobre resultado de  conversaciones intergubernamentales RPDC-Japon
 Pyongyang, 29 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar del dia 26 al 28 en Estocolmo, Suecia, las conversaciones intergubernamentales Republica Popular Democratica de Corea-Japon.
					 En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana la delegacion encabezada por el embajador del MINREX, Song Il Ho, y por la japonesa, la delegacion presidida por el director de Asia y Oceania del MINREX, Junichi Ihara.
					
					 Ambas partes sostuvieron debates sinceros para liquidar el pasado desgraciado, resolver los problemas pendientes y normalizar las relaciones interestatales ateniendose a la Declaracion Corea-Japon de Pyongyang.
					
					 La parte japonesa pidio a la coreana la solucion del problema de restos mortales de los japoneses muertos antes y despues de 1945 en el territorio de la RPDC y la investigacion sobre todos los japoneses como los que se quedaron en Corea, los conyuges japoneses, las victimas de secuestro y los desaparecidos.
					
					 La parte coreana evaluo el reconocimiento de la parte japonesa sobre los esfuerzos que realizo en el pasado la RPDC por la solucion del problema de secuestro, y expreso la voluntad de resolver definitivamente todos los problemas relacionados con los japoneses a traves de la investigacion comprensiva y total, aunque tenia la posicion anterior.
					
					 La parte japonesa expuso su voluntad de levantar en definitiva las medidas de sancion que toma ahora independientemente contra la RPDC.
					
					 Ambas partes acordaron hacer los siguientes puntos en un tiempo cercano estrechando los debates:
					
					 La parte japonesa expuso nuevamente la voluntad de liquidar con la parte de la RPDC el pasado desgraciado, solucionar los problemas pendientes y normalizar las relaciones interestatales segun la Declaracion Corea-Japon de Pyongyang y decidio proceder con actitud sincera a la solucion de los problemas para crear la confianza y mejorar las relaciones entre los dos paises.
					
					 Desde el momento en que la parte coreana funde el "Comite de Investigacion Especial" para la investigacion comprensiva e inicie esta labor, la parte japonesa eliminara la restriccion de viajes de las personas, la medida especial de control tomada contra la RPDC en cuanto a las remesas y las sumas de dinero, que se puede llevar, y la prohibicion de la entrada en puertos japoneses de los barcos de nacionalidad de la RPDC con fines humanitarios.
					
					 La parte japonesa decidio examinar la puesta en practica de la asistencia humanitaria a la RPDC en un tiempo adecuado.
					
					 La parte japonesa consultara sinceramente segun la Declaracion Corea-Japon de Pyongyang el problema de posicion de los coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					 En cuanto al problema de restos mortales de los japoneses, evaluo la cooperacion de la RPDC brindada para la realizacion de visita a las tumbas por parte de los familiares de difuntos y decidio tomar las medidas necesarias debatiendo de continuo con la RPDC sobre el tratamiento de restos y tumbas de los japoneses abandonados en el territorio de la RPDC y la visita a las tumbas.
					
					 Impulsara de continuo la investigacion sobre los coreanos desaparecidos en el pasado, propuesta por la RPDC, y tomara las medidas pertinentes discutiendo con la parte coreana.
					
					 La parte coreana decidio realizar total y simultaneamente la investigacion comprensiva sobre los restos mortales y tumbas de los japoneses y sobre todos los japoneses, inclusive los que se quedaron en Corea, los conyuges japoneses, las victimas de secuestro y los desaparecidos.
					
					 Para ese fin, fundara el "Comite de Investigacion Especial" investido de facultades especiales e informara a cualquier hora a la parte japonesa el estado de investigacion y confirmacion.
					
					 Al paralelo del tratamiento de restos mortales de los japoneses, en el caso de que se busque a algun sobreviviente japones, consultara el problema de su residencia en la direccion de repatriarlo y tomara las medidas necesarias.
					
					 La investigacion se realizara rapido y los problemas que surjan en su curso seran gestionados de diferentes formas y metodos mediante la consulta continua con la parte japonesa.
					
					 Para confirmar los problemas que se presenten en el curso de investigacion comprensiva, ambas partes facilitaran la entrevista con la persona deseada por la contraparte y la visita a los lugares necesarios y tomaran las medidas adecuadas compartiendo datos vinculados.

articles.title: Acto dedicado a 100o aniversario de cumpleanos de Han Jin Sop
articles.content:
Acto dedicado a 100o aniversario de cumpleanos de Han Jin Sop
 Pyongyang, 29 de mayo (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 100o aniversario de cumpleanos de Han Jin Sop, actor del Pueblo, tuvo lugar este jueves un acto de recordacion en el Teatro Nacional de Drama.
					 Estuvieron presentes los funcionarios, creadores y artistas de la rama de arte teatral, los periodistas y redactores del sector de prensa e informacion, los familiares de Han y otros hombres relacionados.
					
					 En la ocasion, pronuncio las palabras Ri Ji Yong, presidente del Comite Central de la Union de Actores del Teatro de Corea.
					
					 El orador dijo que sin olvidar el 100o aniversario de cumpleanos de Han, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un ofrecio una benevolencia de organizar el acto de recordacion, y prosiguio:
					
					 El Presidente Kim Il Sung formo como actor prestigioso a Han que antes de la liberacion ofrecia su pieza teatral vagabundeando por doquier del pais y le atendio paso a paso para que llevara una vida digna para el desarrollo de literatura y arte del Juche.
					
					 Dirigiendo la creacion de la pelicula "Los cinco hermanos guerrilleros" y los dramas revolucionarios "Ermita Songhwang" y la "Inmolacion en la Conferencia Internacional" en que Han se presento, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il evaluo que el tiene un peculiar arte de hablar y la elevada interpretacion.
					
					 Presento a Han como veterano del arte teatral e hizo enterrar sus restos en el Cementerios de Martires Patrioticos. 
					
					 El orador prosiguio que gracias a los grandes hombres es eterna la vida de Han Jin Sop.
					
					 Acto seguido, hubo charla de quienes llevaron sus actividades artisticas junto con Han.
